definition: lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
seven/7
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: By the time we arrived an hour late she was fuming.
sentences.chinese: 我們晚到了一小時，她正氣得七竅生煙。

sentences.english: By the time we arrived an hour later she was fuming with rage.
sentences.chinese: 我們晚到了一個小時，她正氣得七竅生煙。

sentences.english: After having to wait nearly an hour and a half, she was foaming.
sentences.chinese: 等了將近一個半小時之後，她氣得七竅生煙。

sentences.english: Sir Walter promptly boxed his son's ears.
sentences.chinese: 老沃特聞言七竅生煙，立馬甩了他兒子一個耳光。

sentences.english: He foamed with anger over the matter.
sentences.chinese: 這件事氣得他七竅生煙。

sentences.english: When she heard he would come again, she fumed with anger.
sentences.chinese: 一聽說他又要來，她七竅生煙。

hum/drone/buzz
to boast
to whisper to one another's ear
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to withdraw/to hole up
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end

to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
